page.title: 13BEAK HILLS FARM
page.content: Beak Hills in square 7 is a small mixed farm where sheep and beef cattle are raised. The tenant farmer is the huntsman employed by the Bilsdale Hunt. George Cook and his wife Mary kennel the fox hounds totalling 17.5 couples and 5 couples of pups. Bitch hounds are whelped at the farm and puppies sent to be walked by Hunt members. They come back to Beak Hills in September of their first year. Hunting starts over a large area in October and ends in May. The Hunt is run by a committee and meets on Tuesdays and Saturdays at 11 am during the season. Money is raised during the year with domino drives, sponsored rides, a hunter trial, show jumping event and gymkhana. Each rider also pays an annual subscription. A farmer whose land is in the area used for fox hunting would pay less.
